Description: Bowl; earthenware; of Nile silt ware, covered with an orange to cream-coloured slip. There is a frieze of animals and plants between bands and ovolos: a female and male lion confronted, an oryx and a hare, and two oryx confronted, all interspersed with stylised trees and plants, most of which are probably vines; antelope; painted in black with red details.
Bibliographic references: Buckton 1994 / Byzantium: Treasures of Byzantine art and culture from British collections (56)
